Great team game, Great community. Made a bunch of new buds over the past year or so. IDK about after joining steam unfortunately, especially judging by the review section of the steam page. I'm left Disappointed by humanity once again. People are unhinged and ill mannered, raised without care. I hope you all find peace and evolve as people. I'm grateful I never have to meet or deal with people as mentally ill /terminally online and unhappy as the ones writing these reviews in my line of work, good luck devs! <3
just no. id rather get kicked in the balls with a shoe full of spikes than play this shit.

Connection terminated.

I'm sorry to interrupt you Elizabeth, if you still even remember that name. But I'm afraid you've been misinformed. You are not here to receive a gift, nor have you been called here by the individual you assume. Although you have indeed been called.

You have all been called here. Into a labyrinth of sounds and smells, misdirection and misfortune. A labyrinth with no exit, a maze with no prize. You don't even realize that you are trapped. Your lust for blood has driven you in endless circles, chasing the cries of children in some unseen chamber, always seeming so near, yet somehow out of reach.

But you will never find them, none of you will. This is where your story ends.

And to you, my brave volunteer, who somehow found this job listing not intended for you. Although there was a way out planned for you, I have a feeling that's not what you want. I have a feeling that you are right where you want to be. I am remaining as well, I am nearby.

This place will not be remembered, and the memory of everything that started this can finally begin to fade away. As the agony of every tragedy should. And to you monsters trapped in the corridors: Be still and give up your spirits, they don't belong to you.

For most of you, I believe there is peace and perhaps more waiting for you after the smoke clears. Although, for one of you, the darkest pit of Hell has opened to swallow you whole, so don't keep the devil waiting, old friend.

My daughter, if you can hear me, I knew you would return as well. It's in your nature to protect the innocent. I'm sorry that on that day, the day you were shut out and left to die, no one was there to lift you up into their arms the way you lifted others into yours. And then, what became of you.

I should have known you wouldn't be content to disappear, not my daughter. I couldn't save you then, so let me save you now.

It's time to rest. For you, and for those you have carried in your arms.

This ends for all of us.

End communication.

Iâ€™m gonna do a genuine review cause I donâ€™t think anybody should play this game despise me playing it. 

Overwatch is pretty clear that the devs donâ€™t play their game. With the mid season 5 patch notes, theyâ€™ve stated that theyâ€™ve buffed headshot damage to a spam character to â€œpromote accuracy.â€ Not only that, they ONLY look at statistics for their games and see if stuff is working. The downside is theyâ€™ll see a character have a 50% win rate and think itâ€™s balanced. But the character can be super boring to play. 

Another aspect is theyâ€™ve completely gutted their PvE despise the whole selling point for overwatch 2 is the PvE. Itâ€™s just sad, and embarrassing. Even though theyâ€™ve switched their dedication to the PvP. Itâ€™s still super frustrating to play. Theyâ€™ll take forever if one character is busted, if the change isnâ€™t good. You have to wait another 30 days to see if that patch notes is good. 

Not only that, the whole Activision Blizzard team donâ€™t care about their employees or their player base. With the terrible lawsuit including stuff such as stealing breast milk, sexual harassment which caused one of their workers to suicide, and unfair treatment to their male counterparts. Itâ€™s just sick reading through the allegations of the lawsuit itself. Not only they lack care in their workplace, they donâ€™t care about you as a player. They gutted Overwatch 1 just to monetize heavily off of you, the balancing of this game is absurd and overwatch lying to us for the PvE. 

At this point, if you want a F2P team based shooter. Play team fortress 2. If you want to spend $15, I recommend buying a game that comes from labor of love instead coming from a horrible soulless industry. I personally recommend playing Oneshot, great game. If you still want a PvP game. Get Battlebit Remastered. Somehow a 3 dev team can add more content than an AAA studio.

I play this game every week with the boys and we have a blast. - Anyone that thinks OW1 is better than OW2 gameplay wise. They forget how horrid balancing and the content drought was after year 1. 

The Battle Pass is one of the more generous F2P Models. (in comparison to League, Diablo 4's, Warzone, Mobile games, and any triple A release with a BP usually sucks.), if Battle Passes should continue to exist, this is one of the better ones... but it is a Battle Pass. 

There is still a great concern from pivoting from f2p lootbox system to a bi-monthly 10 dollar subscription for cosmetics. In tandem, changing the market from casual play to FOMO incentive.

Greater concern from Blizzard is the Invasion PvE game, where you have to pay $15 for it. There will continue to be PvE events for purchase that will also cost $15. OW PvE content was always kind of stinky, and I can assume that this is just as bad. (I'm not buying it to confirm if it is bad lol.)

The gameplay of PvP and continuous patches and content drops have all varied from decent to great, and a year into the game's PvP, still feels very exciting. All new characters released have been great, none of them have felt truly overpowered at a casual level. -- Downside is that earning them during the season is a pain, but are far easier after their release season. Additionally, these characters are locked from competitive for the first few weeks either way to allow time for balancing... 

The game/Blizzard's marketing and preying on the players is the real reason that OW2 gets backlash and deserves it. The developers for once seem to have an actual interest and passion for the PvP gameplay of OW and its incredibly refreshing to see/play. Of course, the higher ups just want $$$.

TLDR: 
-Battlepass is tolerable. 
-High Cosmetic prices that are not worth your time
-PvE content costs money and will continue to cost money. 
--The FOMO based system for the shop. 
-PvP Gameplay is better than ever and actively worked on and not left to die. 
-5v5 now plays better but it is unfortunate that parties of 6 who used to play OW1 can no longer do so. 
-Toxic fanbase 
-Devs actually care about PvP now.
-Make sure that you play other games too aside from OW2 so you don't mald. Its good for you to not play the same game for 1k hours.

You know.. I'm playing this hellhole of a game since 2016 and it was really great in the beginning.. the new player experience is terrible. i lost access to my old blizzard account, so i thought this would be a perfect opportunity to start overwatch fresh.

the new player experience is horrible. most heroes are locked. no voice chat allowed. game handholds you constantly, essentially dictating where and what you need to be playing at all times.

i also don't want your stupid battle pass blizzard, knock it off.
Its not good play something else spare you sanity

Core gameplay is fun enough when not horrendously balanced 
However blizzard is absolute scum, beyond the awful design ethic the dev team's actual ethics are down the drain too 

They marketed OW2 as a free game with paid PVE, and that if you purchased OW1 before a certain date you'd get OW2 PVE for free. 
That didn't happen, you got a free charm and boring skin instead and the game didn't even include PVE.
When PVE finally came out it included almost nothing promised and could be completed in under 3 hours, and as you might guess OW1 players didn't get it for free.

Game can be good but routinely wants to gouge you for money, with overpriced skins and battlepasses and every form of microtransaction possible with 2 different types of premium currency and dripfed content.

The artists and actual people working on the game deserve better than the corporate shill sexual predators they have.

My god where do i start, i can finally write a review showing my experience of this game. I don't think i can be bothered writing a whole essay about the game itself, just look at any lengthy review in the top 100 reviews - those sum up most of my thoughts about how dogshit the game has been managed over the years. I've been an overwatch player since release day, and i still play it now (albeit rarely) just to remind myself how shit the game is. Probably clocked anywhere between 5-10k hours maining flex, then tank in OW1 and dps in OW2. I have like 5-6 permabanned accounts since i started playing on PC in august 2019, yet i still kept coming back because my god this game was masterclass. Nothing like it back in 2016, still nothing like it now, at its core at least. I remember seeing it installed on my siblings xbox one randomly one day cus my brother bought it, and i decided to try it and i got fucking hooked just like everyone else. I can't even begin to explain how much fun it was to play this game from 2016-2019, queuing comp to no end, getting 5+ win streaks and insane SR gains, trying out different strats in koth to find new team comps, locking in hog and ball torture, trying to perform dive correctly in low diamond, Those were the days. But my god I absolutely, 100%, undoubtedly, despise Blizzard Entertainment with a burning passion. For what they did to this game, starting with the release of brig, taking months to nerf shield meta, deployables spamming, goats, etc. they should be behind bars imo. OW2 was the last thing us og players had to hang on with our tiny bit of hope, and it got released, and nobody knew how it felt for a good couple weeks. But the new ranking system smacking us in the face was a fucking horrible welcome, yet we were optimistic. At the time i was a 3500 player and i got placed like high plat cus of the hard (?) reset, so surely i would climb with relative ease. I win 7, lose 4, unchanged rank, I win 7 lose 6, i go down a rank, I win 7 lose 1, MAYBE i go up a single rank. 7-1 is like a 92% winrate or something and i just about can get a rank up? really? This dogshit ranking system was the first sign that this game was finally gone. The new ranking system alongside the insanely terrible new 1 tank rule making tank just counterpicking, dps still being defenseless against tanks, and supports being better dps, just made this game fucking dead. I really, really hate to see this game i once loved get stabbed in the chest over and over and over, but I doubt there's much blizzard can (WILL) do to fix the many fundamental issues thats killed this game. Maybe, by the grace of the gods, blizzard will just say like "Hey guys new dev update, we're reopening the ow1 servers to whoever wants to play only ow1, because we said ow1 and ow2 are Technically Different Games". Just a dream, but oh well. I guess overwatch is just gone now. My favourite game ever is just a hollow shell of the greatness it used to be. With the least due respect i could ever have, Fuck you Blizzard.

Overwatch as a whole is dead and gone. I played the original on launch day and the first months were undeniably fun with friends. Still, the easy-to-spot design flaws that would clearly hurt the game in the long run were there from the very beginning, but never taken seriously by management. Every attempt to balance the game would only make it worse and every match felt the same, as you had close to no chances of winning when not playing meta comp. Then, there were visible cuts to development costs and everything felt cheaper and cheaper, from lore animations turned into slideshows to repeated events and dubious character designs.

It's bizarre how a game that initially felt so polished and alive could quickly turn into little more than a soulless and effortless stretch for money, to a point even other mismanaged games such as Paladins would play better.
